name: JFrogGo
description: Build and publish go packages from and to Artifactory while allowing to collect build-info. The collected build-info can be later published to Artifactory by the "JFrog Publish Build Info" task.
author: JFrog

inputs.name: customCommand
inputs.label: Go command to execute
inputs.helpMarkDown: A custom Go command to execute. For example, to execute 'go version', enter 'version'.

inputs.name: goArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional arguments to the selected command. For example, build-time arguments for the 'go build' command.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of the Go project that is being published.

inputs.name: artifactoryConnection
inputs.label: Artifactory service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Artifactory service to be used by this task.

inputs.name: resolutionRepo
inputs.label: Go dependencies resolution repository
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The Go dependencies resolution repository.
A virtual Go repository.

inputs.name: targetRepo
inputs.label: Go target repository
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The target Go repository
Can be a local repository or a virtual Go repository with a Default Deployment Repository.

inputs.name: collectBuildInfo
inputs.label: Collect build info
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select to collect build info and store it locally.
The build info can be later published to Artifactory using the "JFrog Publish Build Info" task.

inputs.name: buildName
inputs.label: Build name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build name.
To use the default build name of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.DefinitionName)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'JFrog Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build number.
To use the default build number of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.BuildNumber)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'JFrog Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: includeEnvVars
inputs.label: Include environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to include environment variables in the published build info.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory where the command will run. When empty, the root of the repository (for builds) or artifacts (for releases) is used, which is the value of '$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)'.
